short_summary: Inspections of emergency systems in Summerland National Park
description: Parks Canada Agency (PCA) requires the services of a specialized firm whose mandate will be to inspect the following components: Monthly and annual inspection of the fire alarm system (1077 and 1078); Monthly and annual inspection of the intrusion alarm system (1077 and 1078); Annual inspection of the emergency lighting (1070, 1075 and 1075); Connection to the monitoring station. The services are required to be performed according to the Regional Operations Centre and Management hangar winter forward (approximately 200 Massey Road) and logged in the system camera server located within the Regional Operations Centre. Services will be performed according to paragraphs 9.5 of the Purchasing and Contracting chapter of the Parks Canada Directive 1. Service will be delivered based on the services described in this Contract. Date of delivery can change based on contract renewal.
full_summary:
### Emergency Systems Inspections, La Mauricie National Park
#### Tender Announcement Reference: PW-23-01029915 (Amendment 1)

Parks Canada has issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the provision of specialized inspection services for emergency systems within La Mauricie National Park. The services required include regular inspections of fire alarm, intrusion alarm, and emergency lighting systems, as well as connection to a monitoring station.

### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference:** PW-23-01029915 (Amendment 1)
* **Solicitation Number:** 5P300-22-0315/A
* **Publication Date:** 2023-03-13
* **Tender Closing Date:** 2023-03-22T14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start and End Dates:** None (contract period: from contract award to 30 April 2024 inclusive)
* **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding
* **Regions of Opportunity/ Delivery:** Canada (specifically, Quebec, excluding National Capital Region)

### Key Requirements

* The contractor must ensure that all work is performed in accordance with the National Parks Regulations and the National Park Act.
* New personnel security clearance requests will require mandatory fingerprints for the criminal record check process.
* Bidders are required to submit their proposals via fax or email (use of SAP Ariba is not accepted).
* The proposal documents and any addenda can be obtained from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca).
* Bidders must obtain contract documents from the government's tendering service to ensure accuracy and authenticity.

### Contact Information

* Jaime Creaser (Contracting Authority)
* Email: Jaime.Creaser@pc.gc.ca
* Phone: 902-266-8592

### Tender Documents

The tender documents, including the amendment package, can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca](http://www.canadabuys.canada.ca). Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both official languages; however, any discrepancies should be reported to the contracting authority.
